name: Excellent Discovery Conversation

transcript.content: Good morning. I have about 30 minutes for this call.
Thank you for making time, Herr Mueller. I noticed your company recently expanded to 3 new locations - is that still accurate?
Yes, that's right. We opened two sites in Bavaria and one in Saxony last year. You've done your homework.
I imagine coordinating IT infrastructure across multiple locations creates some coordination challenges. What's been most difficult about that expansion?
Well, our servers are 7 years old and we've had increasing downtime issues. Just last month we had a full day outage that stopped production at two sites.
A full day of production stopped - what impact did that have on your delivery commitments?
We had to delay three customer shipments. One of our biggest clients was not happy at all. My production manager was furious.
When you mention the client wasn't happy - how does that affect your relationship with them going forward?
Honestly, they've started asking for backup supplier information. After 8 years of partnership. That's what really concerns me.
That sounds serious. Do you have a sense of how much revenue is at risk if they were to reduce their orders or move to a competitor?
They represent about 15% of our annual revenue - roughly EUR 4 million. And replacing that business in today's market... it would take years.
EUR 4 million at risk. And you mentioned your IT team is dealing with this aging infrastructure - how is that affecting them?
They're exhausted. Working weekends, constant firefighting. I've already lost one senior admin who got tired of the chaos. Recruiting a replacement has been impossible.
If you could get your infrastructure stabilized and eliminate these outages, what would that mean for your ability to keep that major client?

It would be transformative. We could actually promise reliable delivery again. And my team could focus on improvements instead of just keeping the lights on. We need to do something - I just haven't figured out what.
That makes sense. Before we explore any options, could you help me understand - what has stopped you from addressing this sooner?
Budget, mainly. And honestly, we didn't realize how bad it had gotten until that major outage. The board is now asking questions about our digital readiness.

notes: Demonstrates: confirming-over-asking opener, proper S->P->I->N progression, no premature pitch, monetization questions that unlocked EUR 4M risk figure, empathetic framing
